paragraphs.body: The Official Avatar Aang Fan Club was an organization consisting primarily of young women who adored ${link_0} ${link_1} and, subsequently, the ${link_2}. The members of the group were later taught the ways of the Air Nomads by Aang himself and became the ${link_3}.
paragraphs.text: The Official Avatar Aang Fan Club was an organization consisting primarily of young women who adored Avatar Aang and, subsequently, the Air Nomads. The members of the group were later taught the ways of the Air Nomads by Aang himself and became the Air Acolytes.

paragraphs.body: After visiting ${link_0}, ${link_1} and Avatar Aang returned to ${link_2} to negotiate changes regarding the ${link_3} with ${link_4} ${link_5}. The couple encountered two of the club's co-founders, ${link_6} and ${link_7}, while in search of the ${link_8}. The girls offered Aang and Katara lodging in the organization's clubhouse. It was modeled after the ${link_9} to pay homage to the Air Nomads and because most of the club's members were female.
paragraphs.text: After visiting Yu Dao, Katara and Avatar Aang returned to Ba Sing Se to negotiate changes regarding the Harmony Restoration Movement with Earth King Kuei. The couple encountered two of the club's co-founders, Hei-Won and Won-Yee, while in search of the Jasmine Dragon. The girls offered Aang and Katara lodging in the organization's clubhouse. It was modeled after the Western Air Temple to pay homage to the Air Nomads and because most of the club's members were female.

paragraphs.body: The next morning, Aang demonstrated some ${link_0} moves to the members of the club, prompting the girls to fawn over him even more, much to Katara's dismay. Another of the club's co-founders, ${link_1}, presented Aang with an ${link_2} that she purchased from a traveling merchant. Aang proceeded to play the instrument, causing the girls to shower him with adoration yet again. Katara reminded Aang that their main objective was to find the Earth King, and the two left.
paragraphs.text: The next morning, Aang demonstrated some airbending moves to the members of the club, prompting the girls to fawn over him even more, much to Katara's dismay. Another of the club's co-founders, Yee-Li, presented Aang with an airbender's flute that she purchased from a traveling merchant. Aang proceeded to play the instrument, causing the girls to shower him with adoration yet again. Katara reminded Aang that their main objective was to find the Earth King, and the two left.

paragraphs.body: After Aang and Katara's meeting with the Earth King, they quickly planned to return to Yu Dao in order to get as many people as possible to evacuate. Overhearing their "mission", Yee-Li immediately sent a ${link_0} to her "sisters of the Yu Dao Chapter" to request assistance for the Avatar.
paragraphs.text: After Aang and Katara's meeting with the Earth King, they quickly planned to return to Yu Dao in order to get as many people as possible to evacuate. Overhearing their "mission", Yee-Li immediately sent a messenger hawk to her "sisters of the Yu Dao Chapter" to request assistance for the Avatar.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} decided to teach the traditions of the ${link_1} to the members of the fan club, renaming them the ${link_2}.
paragraphs.text: Aang decided to teach the traditions of the Air Nomads to the members of the fan club, renaming them the Air Acolytes.

paragraphs.body: Aang later met the Yu Dao chapter of his fan club, which was more concerned about upholding Air Nomad traditions than the Ba Sing Se chapter. When the Avatar first met them, he thought that their ${link_0} were a disgrace to the culture of airbending mastery, and was frustrated with them. However, as time moved along, Aang saw that they truly strove to live by Air Nomad traditions, and decided that he would teach them more about the cultures of his people. He eventually decided that from that point on, the fan club would be no more, and would be known as the Air Acolytes.
paragraphs.text: Aang later met the Yu Dao chapter of his fan club, which was more concerned about upholding Air Nomad traditions than the Ba Sing Se chapter. When the Avatar first met them, he thought that their tattoos were a disgrace to the culture of airbending mastery, and was frustrated with them. However, as time moved along, Aang saw that they truly strove to live by Air Nomad traditions, and decided that he would teach them more about the cultures of his people. He eventually decided that from that point on, the fan club would be no more, and would be known as the Air Acolytes.

paragraphs.body: The clubhouse of the Official ${link_0} ${link_1} Fan Club's ${link_2} chapter was modeled after the ${link_3}.
paragraphs.text: The clubhouse of the Official Avatar Aang Fan Club's Ba Sing Se chapter was modeled after the Western Air Temple.

paragraphs.body: The Official Avatar Aang Fan Club's Ba Sing Se chapter operated within a clubhouse located in the ${link_0} capital. Won-Yee designed the exterior to resemble the layout of the Western Air Temple, albeit loosely, with literally inverted structures and decor.
paragraphs.text: The Official Avatar Aang Fan Club's Ba Sing Se chapter operated within a clubhouse located in the Earth Kingdom capital. Won-Yee designed the exterior to resemble the layout of the Western Air Temple, albeit loosely, with literally inverted structures and decor.

paragraphs.body: The interior of the clubhouse was decorated with several nomadic furnishings, including Air Nomad and airbending emblems, ${link_0} paintings, and posters of Avatar Aang.
paragraphs.text: The interior of the clubhouse was decorated with several nomadic furnishings, including Air Nomad and airbending emblems, flying bison paintings, and posters of Avatar Aang.
